meanings.definition: Difficult to deal with; argumentative or irritable.
meanings.sent1: The old man's cantankerousness made it hard for anyone to approach him.
meanings.sent2: Her cantankerousness often led to heated arguments with her siblings.
meanings.sent3: Despite his cantankerousness, he always had a soft spot for his pet cat.
meanings.sent4: The stormy weather matched the cantankerousness of the sea that day.
meanings.sent5: The cantankerousness of the broken machine frustrated the repairman.

meanings.definition: The quality of being bad-tempered or quarrelsome.
meanings.sent1: The cantankerousness of the customer made the waiter's job challenging.
meanings.sent2: His cantankerousness often resulted in conflicts with his coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The cantankerousness of the grumpy cat was oddly endearing to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The cantankerousness of the lioness protected her cubs fiercely.
meanings.sent5: The cantankerousness of the judge was evident in his stern rulings.
